titleStmt.title: A white sheete, or A warning for whoremongers A sermon preached in the parish church of St. Swithins by London-stone, the 19. of Iuly, anno Domi: 1629. the day appointed by honorable authoritie, for penance to be done, by an inhabitant there, for fornication, continued more then two yeares, with his maide-seruant. By Richard Cooke B: of D: and parson there.
titleStmt.author: Cooke, Richard, 1574 or 5-1639.

titleStmt.title: A white sheete, or A warning for whoremongers A sermon preached in the parish church of St. Swithins by London-stone, the 19. of Iuly, anno Domi: 1629. the day appointed by honorable authoritie, for penance to be done, by an inhabitant there, for fornication, continued more then two yeares, with his maide-seruant. By Richard Cooke B: of D: and parson there.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Dawson for Henry Overton, and are to be sold at the entrance into Popes-head-Alley, out of Lumbard-streete,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in Yale University. Library.
